 First of all, "Darwinian theory" didn't include mutation. Darwin had no concept of any such mechanism. Darwin recognized that in all populations of organisms there existed a vast amount of genetic diversity. But Darwin didn't know and didn't offer an opinion as the the source of that diversity. It is, in fact, as a result of careful examination of the evidence for Darwinian theory that the other mechanisms of evolution, besides natural selection, have been discovered. Thus, the assertion that careful examination of the evidence for Darwinian theory should be encouraged is a boat that sailed over 100 years ago. Darwin's evidence was examined from day one.
 
 So now let's examine the first sentence of the manifesto: "We are skeptical of claims for the ability of random mutation and natural selection to account for the complexity of life."
 
 How wonderful! A total of 737 scientists, not a whole lot of whom are evolutionary biologists, have signed this document. Now consider that about 1% of PhD scientists are named some form of "Steve." Thus, the Steve List, named in honor of the late Stephen Jay Gould. Originally intended to be signed by PhD biologists named Steve, the list also includes other prominent scientists from other disciplines, including Stephen Hawking. The signatories of the Steve List accept the tenets of evolutionary theory while they reject creationism and ID creationism. To date, there are 1157 PhD scientists (about half are biologists) who have signed the Steve document.
 
 Now you do the math. By my calculations that equates to only about 0.6% of PhD scientists who are creationists or IDcreationists. While neither list actually restricts signatories to biologists, both claim to include only PhD scientists. Upon closer examination, that seems to hold true for the Steve list but not the IDcreationist list. Moreover, biologists seem to be more numerous on the Steve list.
 
 As for the "reputable institutions on that list," that is a boondoggle, since individuals signed the list, not institutions. My bet is that every "reputable institution" represented on your list is also represented on the Steve list.
